Params: {3: 'On that day, humanity once more stands at a crossroads that leads to its ultimate end.'}
{3: "The moment Gestalt's data wall opens, the hall plunges into darkness. Only crimson warning lights frantically flash across the screen."}
{3: "The entire Babylonia begins to shake in sync with Gestalt's tremors."}
{3: 'Violent crimson lightning crackles under the alloy shell as the Punishing virus seeps out.'}
{3: 'These Punishing Viruses contract inward, forming a "dark star" about the size of a human eye—this is the core of that corrupting memetic.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "...It was always going to come to this, wasn't it?", 4: '2', 5: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: '"This time" begins on December 20, 2160... and there are only five days left until December 20 of this year, aren\'t there?', 4: '2', 5: '1'}
{3: 'Just as the "dark star" gazes upon Ishmael, she is also staring at the "dark star" that has been imprisoned for over 30 years.'}
{1: 'She sees the future of the "dark star."', 3: '40'}
{3: 'She sees the future of the "dark star."'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Corrupted by a twisted persona, she reclaims the mantle of Agent Zero.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'In a bid to regain her full capabilities, she is taken in by Selene, who wields a matching power.'}
{3: 'Only to be separated again during the battle at Hetero Tower.'}
{3: 'As long as the Punishing Virus endures, the "dark star\'s" authority will remain, forcing her to be both controlled and embraced.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Ultimately, she transfers to the next suitable host capable of accepting her.'}
{1: ">>We've acquired Agent Zero's authority. Integrating it with current permissions>>>", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory876.jpg', 6: '1'}
{3: 'She finally recalls that she once had the same authority as Agent Zero—the same origin, the same record logs.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Data sync in progress. Updating her memory.', 4: '1'}
{1: "This node's record differs significantly from the way this world has developed. Continue with the sync?", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory876.jpg', 6: '1'}
{1: 'On December 25, 2197, arrive at the Zero-Point Energy Extraction Center—operation successful', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory951.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'Mission: Gather all data from the target civilization and retrieve the "Gate".', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory951.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: 'Detect the most advanced technology of this civilization—a Time Travel Capsule—and designate it as top-priority target.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg2601_11.jpg', 6: '1'}
{1: 'Hack into the Time Travel Capsule. Adaptation successful.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg2601_11.jpg', 6: '1'}

{1: "Infiltration and spread now encompass 10.97% of the city's population. The leading mind in human scientific research has perished because of it, and humans dismiss it as a mere accident.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory951.png', 6: '1', 9: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Elderly Professor', 3: "Let's head to the auditorium, Dominik. You're next on stage.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Am I truly fit to be the Chief Technology Officer of the Science Council?'}
{2: 'Elderly Professor', 3: "You're his only student, and you've made remarkable strides for someone so young. We all see your potential—believe in yourself.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "Professor, so... you're heading out next, aren't you?"}
{2: 'Elderly Professor', 3: "I'm old now. It's time I left the next steps to you and the others of your generation.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Dominic stands in the dreary rain, mulling over the phrase "young people" for what feels like ages.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: "How's Nemo doing lately? I remember back when we were in school together a few years ago—he had pretty decent grades."}
{3: "Hearing his son's name, the professor lets out a weary sigh."}

{2: 'Elderly Professor', 3: "Since that incident, he's lost all enthusiasm for research. No matter how others try to persuade him, he won't listen. Last month, he went to the countryside, found a local hospital, and began practicing as a psychiatrist.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Elderly Professor', 3: "Come on. If we wait any longer, we'll be late.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maintenance Staff 1', 3: "Hey, take a look at this. If you scan it, would you say it's... a crystal?", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Maintenance Staff 1', 3: "It was on the core's components. At first, I figured it was just dust, but recently... there's more of it showing up, and it really looks like some kind of crystal now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maintenance Staff 3', 3: "Gather that up and deliver it to the Science Council. Let Dominic figure out what we're dealing with.", 4: '3'}
{1: 'The human science leader begins studying the Heteromer Crystal.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory951.png', 6: '1', 7: '-4', 10: '1'}
{1: 'The human science leader is using Time Travel Capsule to accelerate the research.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory951.png', 6: '1', 9: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maintenance Staff 1', 3: "These crystals keep getting bigger, and they're clearly visible now. If we miss even one during cleanup, things could get bad fast.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'The first people infected are labeled as mentally ill by humanity.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: 'This contamination makes them launch interference whenever they spot a high-priority target, helping it spread faster and collect intel.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: "The incubation period is almost up. Thanks to its nature, it's bound to show itself once conflict breaks out.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 9: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maintenance Staff 1', 3: 'As soon as he steps into that time travel capsule, these crystals show up, and they even corrode the parts that go with it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maintenance Staff 2', 3: "The time travel capsule's parts are tough enough to make as it is. If things keep going like this...", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Maintenance Staff 3', 3: "Don't be so down. I believe Dominic will get to the bottom of this. The World Government believes Dominik too, and they're already working on the replacement parts.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Maintenance Staff 3', 3: 'Hey, did you hear? Rumor has it all those riots popping up worldwide might be tied to these crystals...', 4: '3'}

{1: 'People have been using the time travel capsules a lot more often to gather intel, which in turn boosts the amount of these Heteromer Crystals each time they fire one up.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'The single-activation Heteromer Crystal multiplier keeps climbing, now at 71.23%.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'The single-activation Heteromer Crystal multiplier keeps climbing, now at 84.94%.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'The single-activation Heteromer Crystal multiplier keeps climbing, now at 95.15%.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory460.jpg', 6: '1', 10: '1'}
{3: 'Mysterious crystals of unknown origin almost envelop the entire time travel capsule, even trapping the user inside.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maintenance Staff 2', 3: 'Why are you just standing there?! Save her now!!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The harder people try to remove these crystals, the more subtle contamination seeps in.'}
{3: 'The more people try to go back in time to find the truth, the deeper they get pulled in.'}
{3: 'A massive "tower" appears, devouring the building where the time travel capsule is kept. Everyone around is gone without a trace.'}
{3: "No force can scrape off the Heteromer Crystals that's fused with the capsule. Together, they form an ever-growing Babel Tower."}
{1: 'Humanity now knows the complete truth and calls this crystal "Chaos"—the Chaos Contamination.', 3: '45', 4: 'ff4e4eff'}
{3: 'Humanity now knows the complete truth and calls this crystal "Chaos"—the Chaos Contamination.'}
{1: '>>>>>Access conflict detected. Record update failed. Please confirm access to the Hetero Tower core.', 3: '45', 4: 'ff4e4eff'}
{3: '>>>>>Access conflict detected. Record update failed. Please confirm access to the Hetero Tower core.'}
{3: 'She sets the conflict aside for now, emerging from the massive records and carefully mulling over the name she just saw.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Punishing Virus, Chaos Contamination...... When did I forget about all of these...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cradle tilts her head back, her bewitching eyes fixed on the vast night sky.'}
{3: 'Then she shuts her eyes and retraces the tale from its final chapter all the way to its first.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "I'm waiting for you to wake up.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Is it the moment when it takes form of Cradle to rise from the Red Tide?'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "I will cherish... no, make the most of everything I've gained from you."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'For calming the sound of tide on the planet, for that lives can bear greater fruits.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'So that next time... "we" and "you" can meet under better conditions.'}
{3: 'Or is it the moment her data takes over everything, and you find yourself truly excited about this new purpose?'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'I want to understand civilizations, societies... humanity.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'The stories of humans are more important than humans themselves.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'So I sincerely hope you will leave more stories behind.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Even if she's lost sight of her original goal, her instincts still brim with joy whenever she reads these stories, so..."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Go forth, expand, and seize. Just like what other civilizations did when they developed.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Go absorb everything that can enrich us.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Seek out a homeland that can nurture our "civilization."'}
{3: 'She is guided by instinct, finding a similar purpose and longing.'}
{3: "But why does she feel this desire? Why is there a sense of joy? These emotions aren't really hers. It's almost as if..."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Why call it Contamination Memetic? Has it taken on a "human" form before?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After regaining the authority of Agent Zero.'}
{3: 'Under the cloak of night, taking advantage of the sudden invasion of the Hetero-Creatures,'}
{3: "she slips through the Clean Zone—no longer clean after Selene and Agent Zero's defilement—and quietly enters the Hetero Tower."}

{3: 'The guardian who once watched over this place has vanished without a sound. She sees no need to "greet" someone already bound to the "Gate," nor does she feel compelled to "care for" a future still dormant to miracles.'}
{3: 'For the very first time in her life, Cradle feels truly at home. Like a child returning to a long-lost haven, she settles back into the warmth meant solely for her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "Looks like the answer I've been looking for is right here. And the one who robbed me of my memories... is here too.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cradle glances around the Hetero Tower, casually talking to this place she calls "home," as if she\'s alone with her thoughts.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "So... is this the moment when someone's supposed to say...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The core of the Tower glows with a vivid blue light, but all it offers is silence.'}
{3: 'She moves in closer, then closer still, compelled by desire with her objective just within reach.'}
{3: "The moment Cradle assumes the Tower's core is permitting her every action and reaches out to touch it..."}
{3: "A sudden flash of light streaks across, devouring, the Hetero-Creature, Cradle's fingertips."}
{3: 'Crimson radiance pours over her wide, terrified eyes, breaking down the barrier of curiosity bit by bit and laying bare her rawest fear.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "Is the Hetero Tower's core... erasing me?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Since there are established "rules," and we know the "language" that powers them, overwriting the Tower\'s core logic can fundamentally change the way it functions.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'By shifting from "release and activate" to "absorb and obliterate," the region once exposed to the Tower\'s influence will be cleansed of any sign of Punishing Virus.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "This time, it's your turn to be used.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'In that moment, fear stirs the memories long dormant in her mind.'}
{3: 'Snapped awake, Cradle stumbles back, as though the stern young man still hovers at the edge of her vision.'}
{3: 'This marks the start of the story—this is where everything begins.'}

{3: "A young man knocks on the door of Gateway, rewriting the Hetero Tower's core logic. His timing coincides with Agent Zero making a long journey from her own future, determined to invade this world's Hetero Tower."}
{3: 'With the core altered, the "gravely wounded patient" is robbed of every chance at recovery.'}

{3: 'This world is already dominated by the Punishing Virus; there\'s nowhere for her "Chaos Contamination" to spread. Humanity has even branded the tower as "Inver-Hetero", and it\'s no longer her loyal "child."'}
{3: "She's lost her throne, her memories torn away by the endless blue, leaving her to wander adrift and sink beneath the Red Tide."}
{1: '1', 3: '...She remains still until her consciousness fuses with Cradle, slipping into a deep sleep.'}
{3: 'Now that Cradle has regained control of the Hetero Tower, she stands before her "child" once again.'}
{3: 'Even though this "child" has been rewritten, it still watches in silence with its bright blue eyes.'}
{3: 'Cradle takes a moment to think, abruptly stops, then shifts aside and quickly hides herself.'}
{3: "Right in front of the Hetero Tower's core, the dark Agent stops in his tracks."}
{3: "The brilliant light also identifies him as an intruder, but it can't simply consume or erase him with the same method."}
{3: 'Whenever a burst of light streaks by Vonnegut, a faint arc of blue light neatly neutralizes the attack.'}
{3: "A finely tuned force field fits around the Agent like a glove—there's something strangely familiar about it, as if she's seen it somewhere before... but where?"}
{3: "Cradle tries to get a clearer look at these barriers and peeks out, but Vonnegut's eyes instantly lock onto her hiding place."}
{3: "The silent standoff comes to an abrupt end when Cradle beats a quick retreat, fully aware that sticking around won't do her any good."}
{3: "Armed with Agent Zero's clearance, Cradle moves unhindered throughout the Hetero Tower."}
{3: "Meanwhile, the Agent—clearly on guard—stays put in the Tower's central zone, keeping a close watch on her."}
{3: "That means if she tries to seize control of the core again or keep syncing data to learn more about that future, she's bound to collide with him once more."}
{3: "He isn't influenced by the blue core, but if Cradle goes near it, she'll be wiped out."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "...All right, let's give this plan a shot.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Muttering to herself, Cradle stays at a distance from the core.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "I'm not sure who left this behind on their trip to another era, but since I've found it, I'll make good use of it.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A scythe lifts from her hand, its blade aimed at the quietly seeping crimson fissure.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "You're not going to object if I open a bigger portal here and bring in some backup, are you?", 4: '1'}
{3: "A surge of red light tears through the tower wall shaped by the Punishing Virus, sending shards skimming across the regret in Cradle's gaze."}
{3: 'In a few pulses of crimson, the battered wall finally overflows with a watery sheen, and the Red Tide, like a newborn just opening its eyes, begins to stir.'}
{3: 'They flow, spilling into the depths and forming a shimmering crimson stream.'}
{3: 'Cradle plunges her hands into the Red Tide, shaping it into a new pathway.'}
{3: "It barely sets foot on the core area's edge before a sudden burst of light erases it completely."}
{3: 'Then come two, then three, then four.'}
{3: "Under Cradle's watchful eyes, they rush toward the Hetero Tower's core in succession. Yet these fallen bodies can't carve a path; they all disappear at once in the tower's radiant glow."}
{3: 'As always, the light intensifies. The leading Hetero-Creature is the first to utter a tortured wail, and that wail becomes a clarion call, marking the true beginning of their advance.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Once again, they shuffle into a new formation.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The charging Hetero-Creatures dissolve under the brilliant light.'}
{3: "As the first creature's body fades, the rest use its remains as a makeshift shield and push closer to the seemingly unstoppable blue."}
{3: 'One after another, they disintegrate, die, and then reappear, racing through the fading heat of their fallen to reach the source.'}
{3: 'Cradle tenses, then eases up—satisfaction glimmering in her eyes, as though her curiosity has been completely indulged.'}
{3: "She plunges her fingers into the Hetero-Creature she's holding, fully feeling the Red Tide engulf her."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "This should work... If I just boost the Red Tide and churn out a few more of these creatures, I'll be able to reach the Hetero Tower's core.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "You're not going to stop me, Vonnegut?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vonnegut stands at a distance, ignoring the Hetero-Creatures around him, his eyes never leaving the core or Cradle.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "Exactly. Thanks for the intel from Lithos. After gaining Agent Zero's authority, I've started to remember things—at least a part of it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'This Hetero Tower is my <phonetic=child>creation</phonetic>, and also where I came into existence.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'So you want to reach the core by doing this?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "Yeah. It's a bit of a hassle, but all it takes is a small sacrifice.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "This is my solution. But you—who exactly are you? And how do you, as an Agent, manage to keep the core's corruption at bay?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'And also... why are you so knowledgeable about the Hetero Tower?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "Keeping quiet isn't exactly polite by human standards—besides, your story intrigues me.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Alright, so can I count on you to keep watching from the sidelines like this?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "I'm getting my  <phonetic=child>core</phonetic> back, no matter what.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vonnegut snorts in disdain and strikes with lethal force.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Oh? Looks like that line really struck a nerve.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He offers no response, his gaze fixed intently on Cradle.'}
{3: "The girl lets out a sigh as her scythe hangs by her side, its polished surface reflecting her opponent's figure."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Looks like this is your answer. Well, I have to say...', 4: '1'}
